alert.note: Alert for Northern Salinas Valley, Hollister Valley and Carmel Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued December 13 at 12:52PM PST until December 14 at 1:00AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE CARMEL, RIVER, AND WILLOW BURN AREAS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM PST THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall are possible over the Carmel, River and Willow burn areas. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following area, Northern Salinas Valley/Hollister Valley and Carmel Valley. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the Carmel, River and Willow burn areas is expected up to and during the period of the watch. Residents near the Carmel, River and Willow burn areas should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. Soils remain moist and excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Significant runoff may cause flooding of creeks and rivers. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the Carmel, River and Willow burn areas, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following area, Northern Salinas Valley/Hollister Valley and Carmel Valley. * WHEN...From 7 PM PST this evening through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the Carmel, River and Willow burn areas, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued. Local emergency services are monitoring the situation and will issue a public statement as conditions warrant. PLAN NOW so you will know what to do in an emergency. Keep informed by listening to local radio and television for statements and possible warnings. Follow the advice of public safety officials.

area.areaDesc: Northern Salinas Valley, Hollister Valley and Carmel Valley
